reviews.review_msg: For someone who doesn't like math, Ric is a great professor. He explained everything in great detail so I was only lost at one point of the semester. He posts previously recorded lectures where I was able to catch back up quickly.

Going into this class I was really nervous because I am usually not good at math but by the end of it I found the class enjoyable! He was very caring and would try to calm the nerves of students when introducing tough topics :)

Super cool prof made the lectures easy to understand, but they get a bit boring as he speaks in a monotonous voice. It is super hard to reach him outside the class as he doesn't reply to his emails, so until you have a super nice TA good luck with that.

Great professor. Was first statistics class I took and lectures were given at a good pace. TA was really good too. Has accessible video lectures which were helpful. Made a challenging course doable. Sometimes disorganized with posting things on Canvas and doesn't really respond to emails.

i took psyc201w and psyc210 with ric this year. he is a great prof that cares about his students and wants them to succeed and it is evident in the ways he structures his courses, despite the heavy content. his lecture videos and practice questions, as well as worksheets he makes, is easier to manage. would for sure take a course with him again :D

• Really good at explaining concepts
• Has his own YouTube series for his lectures, which was great reinforcement.
• Sometimes would forget to post lecture content/quizzes/homework without explanation

I took PSYC 201 and 210 with Ric this semester and he is great at explaining tough subjects and is very attentive and mindful in lectures. I would definelty take another class with him, the only thing is that he can be a bit disorganized with posting lecture videos especialy with PSYC 201 but other then that he is great to have as a prof.

Ric is very good at explaining concepts. He also provides his youtube lectures which was sooooo helpful to go back and review. Assignments were easy. Midterms were little hard because it was more theory based however if you show up to tutorial and go over his lecture slides and worksheets you should be fine. However he sucks at responding on emails

i would def recommend taking this course with ric. i was intimidated going into a stat course but you could tell he really cared about helping you understand. his lectures were great and explained concepts in a way that made sense. grades were spread pretty evenly across assignments, quizzes and tests which was nice

Great prof, he makes the lectures as entertaining as stats can be, and makes lots of analogies which works really well for me. Very approachable and caring, he even thanked everyone for showing up to the final.  Lectures were very definition/theory based, so definitely go to the tutorials as well because that's where you can do practice problems.

I have taken PSYC 210 and PSYC201 with Ric this semester and its been incredibly frustrating. He is very disorganized and could not keep up with anything. He is impossible to reach via email (even the TAs couldnt reach him sometimes) and was constantly behind on posting or updating assignments and modules. His lectures are hard to follow and boring
He is easily one of the best Instructors at SFU. I believe he made stats interesting or manageable for people who aren't fond of it at all.

I took this class a few semesters ago, so I do not remember a lot of the material. What I do remember is he was a beyond kind professor that really cares about his students and his work. He made lectures entertaining which is next to impossible for statistics and his grading was very fair. Seriously, take 210 with him.
Ric is such a good prof! He posts all his lectures on YouTube and makes them accessible before every class. I have him for PSYC 210 and 201W and everything you need to know is in his lecture videos!
So caring! Gives lots of useful practice, written problems given are just like those in exams, very accessible

Ric is a very organized and caring prof,his lecture notes are clear and what he tests off of. His midterm was multiple choice and a couple long answer so not too bad if you're actively keeping up with the material. After lec 5 it gets very theoretical so make sure to go to lecture, otherwise you wont do well on the final(not cumulative). hes great!

Ric was awesome, I was rly scared for stats, but he made it feel so easy. He provided a free textbook written by one of his colleagues and the chapter were at most 5-10 pages long. Assignments and tests were fair and the weekly quizzes were open for 1 week to complete with no time limit. The labs are very helpful, go to them.

Ric was an incredible prof. He is able to expertly convert complex topics into accessible formats. He is very meticulous in that every word and explanation is well measured and precise. Lectures were straightforward, assignments reasonable, and the online quizzes were an easy grade boost. One of the best profs I've had at SFU.
